utterance.speaker: OLDER MAN
utterance.content: Jackass!

utterance.speaker: RICHARD CASTLE
utterance.content: Ow ow ow! God!

utterance.speaker: PI
utterance.content: Everything okay, Mr. C?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Does everything look okay, Pi?

utterance.speaker: PI
utterance.content: I don’t know. It’s kind of dark in here.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS CASTLE
utterance.content: Dad? What’s going on? What happened?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: My office. Now.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’ve tried to be generous and understanding. I have tried to be tolerant. But Alexis, it’s been over a month and Pi is still here.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I know, Dad. And he feels bad about it. We both do.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t care if he feels bad. I want my couch back. I want my house back. You go back to college next week. What then? Sweetheart, he has to go.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: You’re absolutely right. He’s been here way too long. It’s not right and it’s not fair to you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: You’re welcome. And the best news is, I think we’ve found a place.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Honey, that is so great – – did you say ‘we’ found a place’?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Yeah. Pi and I talked it over. He can’t afford a place on his own so we found one together.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Together?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Yeah. That way the rent’s totally affordable. I can cover my half with a work-study job and it’s right next to school. Plus it’ll save you from having to pay for university housing this year.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You don’t honestly think I’m going to let you do this, do you?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Let me? Dad, I’m 19.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Exactly my point. Far too young to be moving in with someone.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Really? Because I was old enough to sign the lease. And weren’t you living with your girlfriend when you were 19?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes, but that was different?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: How?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Trust me, Dad. We’ve thought this through. It makes total sense.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: In what universe does that make sense? I’ll tell you what universe. The one where she’s blinded by emotion and not thinking straight. It’s like watching a car accident in slow motion.

utterance.speaker: KATE BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, Castle, my Dad wanted to kill the first guy that I moved in with. He did everything he could to try and talk me out of it. And all that did was made me want to do it more.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I just wish her future self would come back and talk to her present self. Let her know what a mistake she’s making. Save her from a – – a world of hurt.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What happened?

utterance.speaker: LANIE PARISH
utterance.content: There are a lot of weirdos out there with too much imagination is what happened. And yes, I’m looking at you, Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, except I only commit my murders on paper. I don’t actually do them. A lot more lucrative, a lot less prison.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So was she electrocuted?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Yep, but that’s not the cause of death. Her throat was cut. The rest of this, if I had to guess, I’d say she was tortured.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why? Who is she?

utterance.speaker: JAVIER ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Shauna Taylor, 34. She’s a parole officer with the Department of Corrections. Could be one of her parolees out for revenge.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How did he get in?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Right now it’s a mystery. There’s no sign of forced entry and by the look of it, she wasn’t expecting trouble.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How can you tell that?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: She had a carry permit for a Sig-9. It’s still in the top drawer of her nightstand.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do we know when this happened?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: I won’t have anything definitive until I get her back to the office.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Neighbors didn’t hear anything. Probably because she was gagged, but the guy who called it in said he saw a guy leaving the apartment about 5:30AM. Said the dude had fresh blood on him. Ryan’s got our witness with the sketch artist now.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, contact DOC, get a list of all of her parolees, see if there’s a match. We’re also going to need alibis for all of them from last night.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What do we know about her family?

utterance.speaker: MALCOLM WICKFIELD
utterance.content: She’s dead? I knew it. I knew something like this would happen. I warned her, didn’t I?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Dr. Wickfield, were you and your stepsister close?

utterance.speaker: MALCOLM
utterance.content: Not really. The two of us had very different lives. Since our father passed, we made an effort. Called each other once, maybe twice a month.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And when you last spoke to her, did she say anything that would indicate she was in trouble?

utterance.speaker: MALCOLM
utterance.content: Yeah, when we – we talked about a week ago. She said she thought someone might be stalking her. She kept seeing this guy wherever she went, watching her.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: One of her parolees?

utterance.speaker: MALCOLM
utterance.content: No. She said she didn’t recognize him. I thought she was just being paranoid.

utterance.speaker: KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: So according to Shauna’s supervisor, all of her parolees were nonviolent offenders and none of them looked like this sketch that we took off the neighbor or match prints that CSU got from the crime scene.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So it’s quite possible this had nothing to do with her job.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Then why torture her? What could the killer want?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What, Castle, no crazy theories?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, he’s got bigger issues. His daughter’s moving in. With a boy.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And you’re letting her?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, apparently the only way to stop her is locking her up, but according to Miss By-the-Book here that’s unlawful imprisonment.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey. Caught a break on that stalker. A couple of nights ago Shauna filed a harassment complaint. Apparently three days ago a guy confronted Shauna on her way home from work. Said the lives of half the people on the planet were at stake.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whatever crazy theory I could have come up with, this is better.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: She managed to get away and ducked inside her building, but when she looked outside her window he was still out there waiting for her, so she called the cops.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did they pick him up?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah. He didn’t have an ID and he was pretty much off his rocker, so they put him on a 72 hour psych hold, but he was released early this morning. They were never able to ID him, but check it out.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Get over to the psych ward. Pull his records. We need to find out who he is.

utterance.speaker: SIMON DOYLE
utterance.content: You do not understand. We are running out of time. I need to get out of here. You have to let me go!

utterance.speaker: PSYCHIATRIST
utterance.content: Why do you feel you need to go?

utterance.speaker: SIMON
utterance.content: Come on, I told you! Shauna is in danger.

utterance.speaker: PSYCHIATRIST
utterance.content: Who is in danger?

utterance.speaker: SIMON
utterance.content: You’re not even listening to me. Shauna Taylor! All I know is 12:58. That is all they told me. That is how it starts and if I am not there to stop it we are all dead. Do you understand me? Dead! Somebody has to let me out of here. All right? Listen to me! I need to save her!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You think by save he meant kill? Because it sounds to me like he really didn’t want her to die.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He’s mentally ill. He may not know the difference.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: 12:58. What do you think that means?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Time. Address. Bible verse.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Or maybe it’s random numbers from a disturbed mind. Either way we’ve got to find him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The guy’s a John Doe. He’s got no ID, no address. Where do we even start?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We’ll put out a BOLO. Get his info to every hospital, precinct, and psych ward in the city.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I’ll send those pictures to shelters and soup kitchens. See if we can get lucky.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I think we just did. That was our victim’s neighbor. He just saw our John Doe breaking back in to Shauna’s apartment.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: NYPD!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Show us your hands!

utterance.speaker: SIMON
utterance.content: No, no! Let me go! You don’t know what you’re doing!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We know exactly what we’re doing.

utterance.speaker: SIMON
utterance.content: Please, listen to me. Don’t do this, please. You have to let me go. If you don’t, a billion people will die.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, how’re they going to die?

utterance.speaker: SIMON
utterance.content: I don’t know. I only know that they do.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah? And how’s that?

utterance.speaker: SIMON
utterance.content: Because. I’m from the future.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This just became my favorite case.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So … future, huh?

utterance.speaker: SIMON
utterance.content: That’s right.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, so why don’t we just start with something simple. Like your name.

utterance.speaker: SIMON
utterance.content: Why does everyone want to know my name? Who cares? It doesn’t matter.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Humor me.

utterance.speaker: SIMON
utterance.content: Fine. You can call me Simon. Simon Doyle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And what year are you from exactly?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Don’t tell me you weren’t wondering.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, what I was actually wondering was what were you doing in Shauna Taylor’s apartment?

utterance.speaker: SIMON
utterance.content: Same thing you were, I expect. Looking for her killer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Except all the evidence points to you.

utterance.speaker: SIMON
utterance.content: Detective, it was my job to prevent her murder. Ipso facto, QED I am not her killer. Point of fact, she was never even supposed to die, okay? But because she has, a chain of events has started that if I do not stop –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Billions of people will die.

utterance.speaker: SIMON
utterance.content: That’s exactly right.

utterance.speaker: SIMON
utterance.content: Look. After the bloody energy wars of 2031 we finally managed to cultivate new sources of power.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Energy wars?

utterance.speaker: SIMON
utterance.content: Yeah, neofascists come to power and try to control the world’s energy supply for a select few. Don’t worry. We defeat them. Turns out, one of these new sources of power is a tachyon generator. It lets us open doors in the time stream continuum allowing us to travel back in time. But of course, because of the possibility of abuse, it was tightly regulated and kept secret from the public.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We have a witness that saw you leaving Shauna Taylor’s apartment shortly after she was killed.

utterance.speaker: SIMON
utterance.content: I’m getting to that. Look – look. I’m a temporal anthropologist. What we do is travel back in time and we study culturally significant eras. Ancient Egypt, Middle Ages … man, I’ve been in Nazi Germany.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Aren’t you worried about the butterfly effect? Accidentally changing something in the past, thus altering the future?

utterance.speaker: SIMON
utterance.content: No. We’re careful. The time machine is mostly self-correcting, okay? Any small changes like a little ripple in a fast moving river, right? It’s done in a second. It doesn’t matter. But if someone was to do something big, if someone was to do something massive, then yes of course, damn right you could change the future. By the way? That’s exactly what just happened. Somebody broke in to our lab, okay? Made an unauthorized jump back in time. Don’t know who, but when they did, the numbers? They started to spike. Not unlike a tide going out before a tsunami.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And what happens when the tsunami hits?

utterance.speaker: SIMON
utterance.content: It hasn’t caught up to us yet. Okay? But when it does, whatever chain of events that has just started now will result in billions of deaths that did not otherwise occur. You understand me?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. Um … Mr. Doyle, let’s say that you are indeed from the future. How did Shauna Taylor fit in to all of this? I mean, how does her death change things so radically?

utterance.speaker: SIMON
utterance.content: I don’t know. All I know is that we traced the first change in the timeline back to her apartment, October 7th, 12:58AM.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Which is why they sent you back. Why you accosted her. To stop that first event.

utterance.speaker: SIMON
utterance.content: And I failed, okay? And now she’s dead. But this is why I was searching her apartment. To find out why she was targeted. Why this person would torture her. There’s a reason he came back in time to find her. She had something he needed. I don’t know what, some piece of information, listen, it doesn’t matter. What matters is that I get out of here, okay? Because it is not too late. I can still stop this.

utterance.speaker: SIMON
utterance.content: But you have to let me go now, okay? I only have a few hours before they recall me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You’re going to be delayed.

utterance.speaker: SIMON
utterance.content: Oh no.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Recall you?

utterance.speaker: SIMON
utterance.content: This is painful. I’m – I’m talking to people who still think the Earth is flat.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey. His fingerprints are a match for the ones we pulled from the crime scene. No question he’s our guy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. No kidding.

utterance.speaker: SIMON
utterance.content: You’re making a huge mistake!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: For the sake of our future, please tell me you don’t believe that guy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, no. But you’ve got to admit, it’s a great story.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Ah, I thought it was kind of derivative.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, like a mash up of 12 Monkeys and Terminator.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, but it’s the way he told it. Total commitment.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Commitment that turned deadly. I mean, to maintain his delusion, Shauna had to die. He might not even know that he killed her.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did you guys find out what this device was Doyle had on him?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, tech says it’s just a bunch of junk thrown together.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What were you expecting, Castle? A time travel device? Dr. Who’s sonic screwdriver?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You watch Dr. Who?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, that’s Lanie. Okay, we’ll hit the morgue. Why don’t you guys time travel over to your desks and let the DA know that we got our killer.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: He’s not your killer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What do you mean?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: I mean, time of death was between midnight and 2AM. Doyle wasn’t released from psychiatric hold until 4AM. It can’t be him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, it has to be him. He was stalking her and he was at the crime scene.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Yeah. Hours after she was dead. In fact, time of death is probably closer to 1AM.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How can you tell that?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Her watch. It stopped at 12:58, probably from one of the electric shocks.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: May I? 12:58. Did you just get a chill?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, Castle. I didn’t just get a chill. Do you want to know why? Because Doyle was at that crime scene and he had plenty of time to change her watch to fit his delusional story. And just because he wasn’t there when she was being murdered, it doesn’t mean that he’s not involved somehow.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: There’s something else. Shauna was with someone the night she was killed. Once I cleaned the blood from the body, I saw these on her neck.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Is that lipstick?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Mmhmm.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She was with a woman.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You guys? Shauna’s stepbrother confirms that she was gay but he’s sure she wasn’t seeing someone.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: There’s nothing in her phone records that would indicate a girlfriend; however; I did find a charge to her credit card for the night that she died.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: George’s Bar. It’s right around the corner from her apartment. Looks like she was buying for two.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Could be our killer. Okay, you guys get over there, see if she was seen with anyone or noticed anything out of the ordinary. I will call the DA. If we can’t charge Doyle with murder, maybe I can get him held with a departmental psych eval until we have some answers.

utterance.speaker: BARTENDER
utterance.content: Yeah, she was here. Why, did something happen to her?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Was she with anyone that night?

utterance.speaker: BARTENDER
utterance.content: Yeah. It was odd. The chick that she was hanging with was a pro.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You mean like a hooker?

utterance.speaker: BARTENDER
utterance.content: Yeah, I bartend weekends down at the Standish. Chick’s a regular in their lounge, targeting upscale men.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You ever see her down here before?

utterance.speaker: BARTENDER
utterance.content: Uh uh. I don’t know if she was working or what, but she and Shauna seemed pretty cozy. They left together.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You know her name?

utterance.speaker: BARTENDER
utterance.content: Veronica. Go up to the Standish. She’ll be hard to miss.

utterance.speaker: VERONICA
utterance.content: Your witnesses are confused. I don’t go to George’s. Not my scene.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, we have security camera footage that shows the two of you leaving there together.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Want to try again?

utterance.speaker: VERONICA
utterance.content: Okay, I left with her. I like a little variety.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And what happened after you left the bar? Did you go to her place?

utterance.speaker: VERONICA
utterance.content: How is that your business?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Because. She’s dead. Killed in her apartment last night.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We found lipstick marks on her neck. When we test them, whose DNA do you think we’re going to find?

utterance.speaker: VERONICA
utterance.content: This wasn’t me. I didn’t do this.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You were with her that night.

utterance.speaker: VERONICA
utterance.content: But only because I was paid to be.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: By who?

utterance.speaker: VERONICA
utterance.content: Some guy. He hired me to come on to her.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: VERONICA
utterance.content: He wanted me to get into her place and steal her keys. I didn’t know he was going to kill her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Is this the guy?

utterance.speaker: VERONICA
utterance.content: No. This guy was way more intense and scary.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who is he?

utterance.speaker: VERONICA
utterance.content: I don’t know. I didn’t want to know. I just did what I had to and got out of there.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: If you didn’t know, then why did you agree to take the job?

utterance.speaker: VERONICA
utterance.content: Because I had no choice. Nick, my manager, said I had to. He said this guy was a friend of his.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So if we are going to find this scary guy, shouldn’t we be tracking down this manager?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We don’t have to. We had Veronica call him and tell him she’s been busted for solicitation. He thinks he’s coming in to bail her out.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So how’s our time traveler?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Oh, he’s still sticking to his story. He keeps checking his watch saying he’s about to be recalled.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mmm. You know, it’s not a total waste. I did get some excellent stock tips.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, don’t invest just yet. Once we find out who hired Veronica then we’ll know how Doyle’s involved.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He’s right back there.

utterance.speaker: SILVERMAN
utterance.content: Right back where?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where is he? Where did he go?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not where. When?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m just saying, what if he was telling the truth and he was recalled back to the future?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He wasn’t recalled to the future. And do you know how I know that? Because he’s not a time traveler.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay. So where is he?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Simple explanation. There was a mix up with the paperwork when his charges were dropped and some desk monkey accidentally let him go and now they are all trying to cover their asses.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s reasonable. It’s unlikely, but it’s reasonable.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo. Any luck finding Doyle?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. Not yet.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hmm. Is that Veronica’s manager?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, Mick Lynden. Just came in. We’re about to lower the boom.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You need a hand?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Nah. We got it. Wouldn’t want you to lose him, too.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Here’s your situation, Mick. Your girl Veronica says she stole the victim’s keys for a friend of yours. That makes you an accessory.

utterance.speaker: MICK LYNDEN
utterance.content: No, man. I swear to God, man, I didn’t know he was going to do this.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah well, good luck getting a jury to buy that. You’re looking at a lot of time, Mr. Lynden.

utterance.speaker: LYNDEN
utterance.content: Hey man, I just got out six months ago.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I’ll tell you what. You tell us everything about that murderous friend of yours and we’ll tell the DA what a swell guy you are.

utterance.speaker: LYNDEN
utterance.content: His name’s Ward. Garrett Ward. He was my cellie at Five Points.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Where can we find him?

utterance.speaker: LYNDEN
utterance.content: I don’t know, man. He found me last week. Said he’d just gotten out, he needed a favor. I figured it was better to do it than end up on his hate list.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You’re afraid of him.

utterance.speaker: LYNDEN
utterance.content: Hell yeah. Everyone was. I mean, this guy was inside a week and he was running the cell block. Guy is ice cold.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What else do you know about him?

utterance.speaker: LYNDEN
utterance.content: Nothing, man. I shared air with this guy for years. Never once did he talk about his family, his hometown, his girl. But he might have been a soldier.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah? Why’s that?

utterance.speaker: LYNDEN
utterance.content: He had that way. Haunted. Always doing pushups. Always on alert.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Know any reason why he’d target Shauna Taylor?

utterance.speaker: LYNDEN
utterance.content: No. He never even mentioned her name. You said before she wasn’t even his parole officer so I have no idea.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Could he have taken her out as a favor to a friend?

utterance.speaker: LYNDEN
utterance.content: That guy didn’t have friends. But uh … sometimes he’d talk about his mission.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What mission?

utterance.speaker: LYNDEN
utterance.content: All he said was that he had unfinished business and it would change everything.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Garrett Ward. Until six years ago, no criminal record. In fact, until six years ago, no record at all. No DMV, no military, nothing.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s impossible.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Unless he’s the other time traveler that Doyle was talking about.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Whoever he is, his record begins when he was arrested for bringing a backpack bomb into a global energy conference here in Manhattan.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And what was his motive?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: At the time the authorities linked him to a radical eco group that was protesting the conference.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: According to his file he’s some sort of anti-science nutjob. They found lots of Unabomber style notebooks on him decrying the “destruction of the rightful kingdom of God by science and technology”.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What’s his connection to Doyle?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Nada.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What do you mean, nada? C’mon, guys! It’s so obvious. Look, Ward is the guy that Doyle was sent back in time to stop, okay? Ward was sent back in time with some history altering mission that he failed to accomplish, ending up in prison. Six years later he is trying to complete that mission. Which is why Doyle has been sent back to now. Because now is when the timeline changed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, I was thinking that maybe Ward and Doyle knew each other in the non-crazy world. Like perhaps that eco group that Ward was supposedly a part of.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay. Less fun.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But why would an anti-science nut torture and murder a parole officer. I mean, what’s her connection to all of this?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We still haven’t found one.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why don’t you guys go back in time and see if you can dig up any of Ward’s known associates from six years ago. Castle and I will look into his case record, see if we can find a connection between him and Shauna Taylor, or perhaps figure out what his unfinished business was.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, Alexis. I do trust you. I’m just saying, deciding to share an apartment with someone you met on a banana plantation a month ago just doesn’t strike me as the smartest decision you’ve ever made.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Alexis – – Alexis –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She hung up on me. Maybe I shouldn’t have said that stuff about the bananas.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Um … you know, Castle, maybe this is a good thing for her. I mean, she sees us and she sees you starting something new. Maybe she’s just trying to figure out how she fits in.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’re saying this is about us?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. Um … I’m saying this is about her. It’s about her growing up.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know what I’d do if I had a time machine?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hmm?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’d go back to relive all those moments. You know, holding her tiny hand, putting her up on my shoulders. Just … can’t believe those times are gone.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I know, Castle, but think of all of the great times that you have to look forward to in her future … and in ours.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, assuming there is a future. If Doyle’s right there may not even be one.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, c’mon, Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whoa. Look at this. It’s an article on the attempted bombing. Look at the picture.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s Malcolm Wickfield, Shauna’s stepbrother. He was at the conference?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He wasn’t just at the conference. He was one of the speakers. Wickfield’s address was unlisted. You had to get it from Central.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s what Ward wanted from Shauna? To find her stepbrother?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He’s going after Wickfield.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: NYPD, Homicide.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What happened?

utterance.speaker: UNIFORM
utterance.content: Wife said some guy just showed up at the door and attacked him. He beat the hell out of him and broke his neck.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So what happened?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What child?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mrs. Wickfield, what exactly did your husband do?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why would anyone target him for that?

utterance.speaker: WICKFIELD
utterance.content: Well, the work is very exciting. But right now it’s all theoretical. What our research really offers is an entirely new way of looking at the universe.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Changing the way that people see the universe? That’s exactly the kind of person whose death could alter the future.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s also the kind of person that a crazy anti-science nut like Ward would fixate on.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Which means any of the other speakers at that conference could be next.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Except now he’s looking for a child.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, contact the conference organizers. Get names of everyone that attended. Let’s see if there are any children on that list. This guy’s gonna kill again and we don’t know anything about him.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I may have found someone who does. That eco group that Ward was supposedly a part of? Well, it’s since disbanded, but its leader was a guy named Jack Hasting. He’s an environmental author now and his new book Our Earth’s End? It’s about the coming eco disasters and the destruction of the human race.

utterance.speaker: JACK HASTING
utterance.content: If you want to know the future, look at the facts. In less than 35 years we’ll have no gas, no coal, and no uranium left. As our energy resources dwindle and needs rise due to global warming, scarcity will spark the inevitable: a massive, bloody world war, probably within the next 40 years.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Massive, bloody energy wars? Just like Doyle described.

utterance.speaker: HASTING
utterance.content: Given how compromised our planet already is, will the human race survive? Thank you.

utterance.speaker: HASTING
utterance.content: Yeah, I knew Garrett Ward. When he first came to us he said all the right things. How big oil and coal were destroying our environment. He even helped me plan that sit-in on the energy conference. After a few weeks it because obvious he didn’t care about the environment. When he was caught with that bomb we realized why.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He was using you to get into the conference.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So how well did you know him personally?

utterance.speaker: HASTING
utterance.content: Enough to know that he was nuts.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How so?

utterance.speaker: HASTING
utterance.content: He was paranoid. Always looking over his shoulder. And he’d say things about the future, messed up things about apocalyptic wars and how the human race needed to be cleansed. It was pretty creepy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Kind of like some of the predictions you just made?

utterance.speaker: HASTING
utterance.content: No, this was different. Ward talked about it like it was real, like it had already happened.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did he ever say anything to you about a child?

utterance.speaker: HASTING
utterance.content: Not that I recall.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What about this guy? Look familiar?

utterance.speaker: HASTING
utterance.content: Sorry.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you know if there was anyone he was close to? Anyone who would know how to find him?

utterance.speaker: HASTING
utterance.content: He burned every bridge he had when he walked in with that bomb. But if you’re looking for him I’d try the East River power plant. That’s where he was living six years ago. He said, uh … … the electromagnetic field made it harder for the government to find him. I told you, the guy was crazy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This place shut down in 2010. You really think he’d come back here?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You can stay in the car if you’re too scared.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Alone? At an abandoned power plant? No, thank you. Maybe we should put something in our vows about following each other into creepy places.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m just saying. Energy wars? A soldier from the future? Everything seems to support Doyle’s story. Aren’t you weirded out by all this?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why would I be weirded out? Ward’s just another paranoid schizophrenic, no different than Ted Kaczynski or Mark David Chapman.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Then how do you explain Doyle?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, probably another crazy who got caught up in his delusion. He and Ward must know each other somehow.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle. Someone’s been here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Don’t – don’t –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s him. C’mon.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Where’re you going?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Call for backup.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Good idea.

utterance.speaker: DOYLE
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: DOYLE
utterance.content: Damn it!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beckett?

utterance.speaker: DOYLE
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ow!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How’d you find us?

utterance.speaker: DOYLE
utterance.content: I didn’t. I was tracking Ward.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You said you didn’t know him, but he recognized you.

utterance.speaker: DOYLE
utterance.content: Oh no, he recognized this. This is a tracing beacon.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A what?

utterance.speaker: DOYLE
utterance.content: All I have to do is touch him with it and our scientists can pull him back.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Drop your weapon! Hands in the air.

utterance.speaker: DOYLE
utterance.content: Okay, Detective. The gun is really not necessary.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The hell it isn’t. How did you get out of holding and how are you involved?

utterance.speaker: DOYLE
utterance.content: You know how. You just don’t want to believe me, but trust me, Detective. We’re on the same side.

utterance.speaker: DOYLE
utterance.content: You do realize I just saved your life, right?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. This is Detective Beckett. I’ve got a suspect at large. I’m going to need patrol sweeps of the area along with full CSU team at the scene.

utterance.speaker: DOYLE
utterance.content: A real charmer, that one. I can’t believe you marry her.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How did you know I marry her?

utterance.speaker: DOYLE
utterance.content: One of your book jackets. You know, “Richard Castle lives in New York with his wife, Senator Beckett, and their three children.”

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Senator?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Three kids?

utterance.speaker: DOYLE
utterance.content: Yeah. Yeah, yeah. It was kind of hard to believe myself, given all the crazy stuff that goes on between you two.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Crazy stuff? What stuff?

utterance.speaker: DOYLE
utterance.content: Are you kidding me? She –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’ll call you back.

utterance.speaker: DOYLE
utterance.content: No, I shouldn’t say. I shouldn’t say. I can tell you, though, that I’m really glad you stopped writing those stupid mystery books, okay? Because your serious literature is so much better.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I write serious literature? Beckett, you hear that?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, I heard. And I’m the president of fantasyland.

utterance.speaker: DOYLE
utterance.content: No, it was – it was Senator, actually. It was – Senator. But not if Ward changes the future, do you understand me?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, but didn’t the time stream already change with Wickfield’s murder?

utterance.speaker: DOYLE
utterance.content: No, no. Wickfield’s death was a minor disruption.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But all the work he was doing?

utterance.speaker: DOYLE
utterance.content: Never amounted to anything. No, he wound up a footnote in history. According to our calculations, the big event – whatever it is – it hasn’t happened yet.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Then why was Ward after him?

utterance.speaker: DOYLE
utterance.content: I don’t know. You said he was looking for a child, right?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, he had –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle! He’s our suspect. Could you please not discuss details of our case with him? Maybe you could come over here and help me look through this stuff. We might find a clue as to who Ward’s next victim is going to be.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: For your information, I wasn’t sharing details of the case. I was playing into his delusion to see what he knew.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look at his. This is a photograph of an old letter addressed to Malcolm Wickfield. It’s dated six years ago.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Looks like it’s from a high school student asking to see him speak at that energy conference. Why would Ward have this?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t know. It’s only the first page, so there’s no name or signature, but look at the words Ward circled.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: “Brooklyn”. “P.S. 311”. “State award last year for my physics project.”

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Each one’s a clue as to the letter writer’s identity. Ward must have been after him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Do you think this is the child Ward’s looking for?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Doyle, do you know who he is?

utterance.speaker: DOYLE
utterance.content: No. No, I’ve never seen him before. But if Ward’s targeting him there must be a reason.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why would Ward be after a high school student?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t know. But we’ve got to find him first.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, but no name and only these clues to go on? It could take days.

utterance.speaker: DOYLE
utterance.content: Hey, can I make a suggestion? Ward. He was working off a photo of the letter. So perhaps the easier path is to ask, where’s the original? It’s bound to have the kid’s name and address.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Are you sure you’ve never seen the kid before?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That’s it.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: From some kid named Paul Deschile.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Wait a second. No. That’s not Deschile. Um … it’s Deschile. He wasn’t looking for ‘the child’, he was looking for ‘Deschile’.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who the hell is Paul Deschile?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: He’s a 21 year old student at Hudson getting his post-doc in theoretical physics.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right, get him into protective custody.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: He’s on leave this semester. The university has no idea where he is. We’re still trying to look for his parents, but they moved out of state a couple years ago.

utterance.speaker: DOYLE
utterance.content: Detective, it’s him. Deschile!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know him?

utterance.speaker: DOYLE
utterance.content: Of course I know him. Everyone knows him. Oh, man. If he’s killed –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, I’ll call you back! Doyle, sit down.

utterance.speaker: DOYLE
utterance.content: No wonder billions of people die.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, who the hell is Paul Deschile?

utterance.speaker: DOYLE
utterance.content: The energy wars, all right? I told you about the other side. A group of fascists. They were worse than the Nazis. They were slaughtering people by the tens of thousands, okay? They were winning. Until Deschile. He and his team, they - they created an energy shield, okay? It was able to stop their weapons. It completely turned the tide. Detective, listen to me! Ward is still out there, obviously fighting for the fascists. They're trying to win the war by rewriting history! And if he kills Deschile there will be no energy shield. And without that energy shield we lose that war! Ward’s going to kill Deschile and that is why billions of people die!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, you know what? We don’t have time for this. Take him to holding, please?

utterance.speaker: DOYLE
utterance.content: Fine. We don’t have time, okay? You’re correct. Forget everything I said. Forget about time travel, forget about wars, none of that matters. All that matters is Deschile, you understand me? You keep him alive! He cannot die!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, Deschile. Paul Deschile. No wait, please don’t – don’t put me on hold.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Anything?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Esposito got ahold of his parents in Oregon. They think he’s staying with a friend in the city, which is who I’m holding for now.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You don’t think any of this could possibly be real, do you?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t know, Castle But I have no intention of letting this kid die. Yes, hi. This is Detective Kate Beckett, NYPD. I’m trying to get ahold of a Paul Deschile. Where? He’s at the planetarium. Wait, just like you told what other guy? Who did you tell?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ward knows.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The planetarium is all the way uptown. We’ll never get there in time.

utterance.speaker: PLANETARIUM NARRATOR
utterance.content: The cosmos is vast and glorious. More wondrous than we can fathom. It takes our breath away and ignites our imagination. It is the essence of time itself, the past, the present, and the future. It’s an enigma seemingly impossible to grasp and yet, we can see its mysteries. We dare to reach out, to understand the swirling galaxies, the exploding stars …

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Freeze!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Don’t even think about it.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: NYPD! Let me see your hands right now!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Knife!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You okay, kid?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why Wickfield? Why Deschile?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What were you hoping to accomplish?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who is that man? You ran from him at the power plant. Why?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Ward, there is no record of you before 2007. Where are you from?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, Ward.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Whatever you thought you were doing, it’s over.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What’d he say?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Nothing.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No apocalyptic visions? No nightmarish warnings of dire things to come?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Whatever delusions he has in his head, he is keeping them to himself.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, if nothing Doyle said was true, why else would Ward target Deschile?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I think we can answer that.

utterance.speaker: PAUL DESCHILE
utterance.content: I’m the one who alerted security to Ward’s behavior at the energy conference six years ago. They stopped him because of me.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It looks like this was all just about revenge.

utterance.speaker: PAUL
utterance.content: I’m just sorry it cost Dr. Wickfield his life. You know, the talk he gave at that conference rocked my world. And if it wasn’t for him I’d probably be doing something completely different with my life.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: C’mon, man. I’ll walk you out.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So there is a simple explanation after all.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes. Now we know why Ward tried to bomb that conference. To kill Deschile. See, in the future when the famous Deschile were giving interviews he’d say that’s where it all started. Consequently Ward will know exactly where and when to find him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You’re trying to drive me crazy, aren’t you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, apparently I already do it - we end up with three kids.

utterance.speaker: DOYLE
utterance.content: Like to know their names?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Doyle? What are you doing out?

utterance.speaker: DOYLE
utterance.content: Well, you said I had a right to an attorney and he said you couldn’t keep me anymore.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What about your psych eval?

utterance.speaker: DOYLE
utterance.content: Oh, please. Are you kidding me? I passed that with flying colors. You should have heard the crazy stuff coming out of my mouth. Growing up in Denver, middle class family. Man, I haven’t lied that much years.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But I –

utterance.speaker: DOYLE
utterance.content: Now, now, Detective. Don’t be upset. Because of you billions of people are alive. Because of you future generations are safe.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t care what you say, Doyle. There’s a connection between you and Ward and it has nothing to do with time travel. And I’m going to find out what it is.

utterance.speaker: DOYLE
utterance.content: Okay. Good luck. Because before yesterday I had never even met Ward.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: That’s not entirely true. I went back through Ward’s incarceration file. Before his trial he spent two weeks in a psychiatric ward being evaluated by the state. In the next room was another patient, a John Doe. I had them pull his photo.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And there’s the connection.

utterance.speaker: DOYLE
utterance.content: No, no. That’s – that’s ridiculous. Because I have never, ever – – oh, wow. That’s really clever.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What? What’s clever?

utterance.speaker: DOYLE
utterance.content: That’s me. Right? But I haven’t done it yet. Don’t you see? Now that they know where Ward is and where he’s going to be they’re going to send me back to make contact. Find out who he’s working for, if they’re planning anything else. It’s perfect.

utterance.speaker: DOYLE
utterance.content: Oh wow. I don’t have much time left. Um … … see you in twenty years.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Is it just me or does that make sense?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No, it’s just you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh! He forgot his little doohickey there.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey. So what happened?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Um … missed him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Um, you know what? After a case like this one I think a warm and cozy bath is in my future. Talk to you tonight?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sounds good.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’re really doing this.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I am. I know what you’re thinking. You’re thinking I’m making a huge mistake.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What if you are? This isn’t something you can go back and undo. Why don’t you wait a year, okay? Move into the dorms. I’m sure Pi can take care of himself. And if after a year you still want to move in together, I won’t say a word.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Yes, you will. I don’t know how this is going to turn out, Dad. None of us do. But it’s my life. My future. I have to find out for myself. Who are you always saying is the smart one in the family?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad, I know what I’m doing. It’ll be okay.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Too soon.

utterance.speaker: THE END
utterance.content: CASTLE
